utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Haven’t we met somewhere before?

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: Really? That’s your line?

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: It’s not a line. I saw you this morning at The Coffee Bean, and then this afternoon at the gym, and now here. Why are you following me?

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: So I could do this.

utterance.speaker: WOMAN
utterance.content: Shh. Shh, shh, shh. It’s okay. Your aorta’s been severed so this will all be over very soon. Don’t fight it. Just look into these pretty brown eyes and drift away.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Babe? Did you set your hair on fire again?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: That was one time. And no. No, no. I’m just, uh - so good looking I’m literally smoking hot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, what do you have?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s just see.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just a –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just a little –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait a second.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh. Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: First day. How’re you feeling?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um … exhilarated and frightened and everything in between. I wish you were coming with.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, sweetie, we talked about this. What am I going to do? Sit outside your office and fetch you coffee?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, you’re great at fetching. I trained you well.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is a good change for us.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. Absolutely. And besides, with all the money I spent on the remodeling of my PI office I’ve gotta take some cases so I can write that place off. Now, come on. Dig in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. I’m so nervous I couldn’t eat.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who said anything about eating? I said, dig in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay … Like, dig dig in, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. Okay. Um …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Full on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Keep going.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Like that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? That was supposed to be a decoder ring.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh my God, this is so beautiful.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um, would you mind getting that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah. Here. Captain Beckett’s phone.

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Uh… Captain Beckett, please.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course. Please wait one moment.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Trade you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Here you go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you. Yeah, this is Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh huh. Okay. Understood. Yeah, you know what? I’m not interested, so why don’t you take me off the list? Thanks. Telemarketers. I swear, there should be tougher laws against them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, if you hadn’t turned down the chance to run for state senate you could have passed some.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wow. I love this. I’m going to cherish this. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, I have got a meeting at 1PP.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Knock ‘em dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Bro, what are you doing? You know I’ve got dibs on Beckett’s desk.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: I will play you Knife, Gun, Kevlar for it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Let’s do this.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Gun.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Knife.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You fool. You brought a knife to a gunfight. Blam.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Two out of three.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No way. Kick rocks.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Javi, we’re pathetic.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, you’re pathetic. You’re the one who got the crappy desk.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, look, I mean, here we are, moving desks. Everyone else is moving up. Gates, she’s the new deputy chief. Beckett, she’s the new Captain.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So when’s it going to be our turn? Get promoted? Make more money?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Bro, where’s this coming from?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Jenny’s pregnant again. We found out last night.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, wow. That’s great. Congratulations!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That is great, right?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah, yeah, yeah. It’s wonderful. But … it’s also another mouth to feed, another body to clothe. And don’t get me started on college tuition.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Kevin, can’t you just for one second celebrate before you start stressing about money again? Sometimes it’s good to just breathe –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yes! Caught ourselves a homicide. Fingers crossed for overtime pay.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Bro, there’s something wrong with you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can I help you?

utterance.speaker: FRANCO MANCINI
utterance.content: Sure as hell can, buddy. I’m Franco Mancini! Nice to finally meet you. Bring it on in. Come here.

utterance.speaker: MANCINI
utterance.content: Great news, huh Ricky? My wife’s sleeping with my brother, not my personal chef. What a relief.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, I’m sorry, you – your wife is having an affair with your brother and you’re happy about it?

utterance.speaker: MANCINI
utterance.content: Hell, I’ve got four other brothers. But my chef is one in a million. His specialty clams are to die for. Thanks again for solving my case, Ricky. You and your associate.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Associate?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Can you wait out in reception? I’ll be with you in a sec.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … Alexis, I don’t want to say you have some explaining to do, but I think you have some explaining to do.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Wait, did I forget to tell you I’ve been working PI cases for you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Must have slipped your mind.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey, didn’t the guys do a fantastic job remodeling the place?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know, right? But you’re changing the subject.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I know, but check it out. Pull on the complete works of Edgar Allen Poe and …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh my God, this turned out so much cooler than I thought it would! Wait, did they do the thing on the desk with the –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Obviously the spring has a trajectory … I’ll make some … okay, back to you. Why – why are you working my cases?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Truth is, it’s all your fault.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You set up shop in my office, behind my back, and it’s my fault?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Exactly. A month ago when you sent me here to open the place for your foreman a potential client came by. I was intrigued, so I sort of said I was your associate and then I kind of solved the case. Since then I’ve closed three others.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alexis, you can’t just – – you’ve closed four cases? That’s more than I have.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I know. Step your game up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about your college courses?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh please, I’ve got that handled. Plus I forged your signature to make sure I got school credit for being an intern.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, that’s Esposito. I have to take this. But we are not done talking.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Good. We need to discuss my profit participation in the company.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Castle –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … Esposito! How’re you doing, buddy? How’s the new boss lady treating you?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She’s ignoring me.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Just like every other woman in his life.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Shut up. So your wife is not answering her cell and we need her authorization to put more officers down here. Is she with you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, sorry. She’s at a meeting at 1PP. What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’re working on a case, you interested?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’d love to! But I’m a little busy with my thriving PI business.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Not really. I closed all the cases.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But since you’re desperate I’ll rearrange my hectic schedule and uh … lend you my expertise. Come on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa. Looks like a Tarantino film came to life in here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Now meet our stars. This is Greg Minoso. Over here we’ve got Jake Fitz. And finally we come to Dustin Chambers.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Check this out. They were each packing identical .40 cals.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I take it they weren’t part of the construction crew?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, renovations aren't scheduled to begin until next week.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, so … what happened?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Truth is, we don’t know yet.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What we do know is that gunfire was heard around 9:07AM and continued for a minute or two.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So they shot each other?

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Nope. Their wounds are from a downward angle, maybe 45 degrees, which means they probably all were shot from up there.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yep, the shooter was definitely up here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: 9 millimeter.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right. Must have capped them from up here: boom, boom, boom, and then boogied out that exit.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh, guys.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Looks like our shooter took a bullet from one of the dead guys down there, falls back, grabs the drop cloth, and it comes with him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right, let’s contact hospitals.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is Beckett’s.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Wait, what did you just say?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I gave it to her this morning. She was here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tell me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Lanie said that blood was a match to Beckett’s.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But there was so much blood. Okay … okay. Look, this is Beckett we’re talking about.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, she’s a tough as they come.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly. So she must have shot those three guys and since she hasn’t contacted us we can assume that their partners abducted her. But why? We need to dig into the backgrounds of those dead shooters. We need to figure out who they’re working with –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s the thing. We can’t. Their IDs are all fake. And their prints aren’t in the system. Castle, do you have any idea what Beckett was doing at that theater?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She was supposed to be at 1PP.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I talked to Gates. Beckett didn’t have anything on the books.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So she lied to me?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Guys? I got a hit on one of the dead shooters’ credit cards. He rented a short term apartment through an online site.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ryan! I’ve got dead space.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Castle, stay put.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where’s Beckett?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: NYPD! Don’t move!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Get on the floor right now!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: On the ground!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: On the floor, right now!

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY SHIPTON
utterance.content: Have you seen the floor? If it’s all the same to you boys, let’s do this standing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Have a seat, Miss Shipton.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Oh no, please. Call me Hayley. I insist anyone that’s frisked me use my given name.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay. Hayley. My partner and I really enjoyed reading your file.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Oh, sweetie. I’m so much more than words on paper.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Born and raised in East London, over in the borough of Hackney.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Rough area. Don’t they have an area nicknamed “The Murder Mile”?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Well, yes. But it’s not without its charms.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Just like you. Love your accent, by the way. Very posh. Where’d you learn to speak like that?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not from the slums she grew up in. And definitely not from your mom, who’s at the tail end of a twenty year prison bid.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah, not wanting to follow in mom’s footsteps you join the Metropolitan Police Service.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And that was an epic fail.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, they booted you out for your tendency to cut legal corners.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Allegedly.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You hung a dealer out of a window in order to get a confession.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Did I hang him out the window? Or did I save him from falling out said window? It’s hard to tell. It’s even harder to prove.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, lucky for us we don’t have to prove that you were hiding in that apartment.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Hiding? No. Lost. I was looking for a Starbucks, actually. Usually they’re so easy to find.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How do you know the guy who rented that apartment?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Unlike the imbeciles who usually sit in this chair, I know my rights. So I would like to leave now.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’ve got a missing NYPD captain, as well as three dead bodies, so you should start talking right now.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. I don’t know anything about –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, come on, Hayley. You can do better than that.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Look. I am just a freelance security specialist. I was hired by an insurance company to catch a hacker who’s been stealing social security numbers from their system.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why were you in that apartment?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I have been following fake IDs made from the stolen social security numbers. And last night I got an alert that five of them are being used together in New York City. Caught my attention so I flew in to investigate.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Five IDs? Are you sure it was five?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Four men and a woman. Greg Minoso, Jake Fitz, Ty Dade, Dustin Chambers, and Susan Emery.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Where were you at 9AM this morning?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: On final approach into JFK and my flight didn’t land until 9:30. And that is all I know. Now, go and check my alibi so I can get the hell out of here.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s hiding something.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We can’t just let her leave.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Her alibi is solid. We have to.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ryan!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I put you down once. I won’t hesitate to do it again.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My name is Richard Castle. That missing captain is my wife.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I didn’t know. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Keep your sorry. Just give me your help. There’s more to this story than you’re telling us. Now she’s been injured and abducted.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I don’t know anything about that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Name your price. Anything you say I’ll pay it. I just want my wife back.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I hope you find her.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo! Unis found a stolen van with blood in it by a dry cleaners on 23rd Street.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Any sign of Beckett?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Officers found the owner locked in the back. They said a woman matching Beckett’s description was there.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hi. I’m Detective Ryan. This is Detective Esposito. This is Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Can you tell us what happened here?

utterance.speaker: DRYCLEANER
utterance.content: Uh, a lady and man burst in. She said she was cop. Bleeding everywhere. Big mess. Those are her clothes.

utterance.speaker: DRYCLEANER
utterance.content: She told man to lock me in bathroom. He did. And that was it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait, she told him? You’re saying she was here of her own volition, not as a hostage?

utterance.speaker: DRYCLEANER
utterance.content: I was hostage. She was in charge. Yeah, that’s here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay, this man that she was with, can you describe him?

utterance.speaker: DRYCLEANER
utterance.content: Uh, late 20s, East Indian, had beard.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did you catch his name?

utterance.speaker: DRYCLEANER
utterance.content: No. But he was in kind of bad shape, too. Headaches, dizzy, said he needed to eat. She told him he probably should have gotten breakfast instead of calling her –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett got a call from someone this morning.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Do you know who she was talking to?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She said it was a telemarketer. What is she doing? What the hell is going on?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, let’s think. Beckett gets a call from a mystery man. Can we trace the phone?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Already checked. Call came from a burner phone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Damnit. All right. She must have met this guy at the theater. Clearly they were ambushed. Beckett gets shot, but she manages to take three of them out and then she and the man escape.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But she didn’t call for backup?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Why wouldn’t she reach out to us?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guys, the woman just sewed herself up with a needle and thread. Clearly something’s going on. She’s afraid to contact anyone.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But what? And – and what could it be that would cause her to react like this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whatever it is it has to do with this man. We find the man, we find Beckett.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right. I’ll have CSU dust this place for prints. Maybe we’ll get an ID on this guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’ll get the drycleaner to sit with a sketch artist.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, Alexis, listen, something –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, come back to the office now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Just hurry. And come alone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. I’ll meet you back at the station.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alexis?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad? We’re in here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We? Beckett?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: That’s it, that’s it.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What the hell’s going on here?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Oh, I hope you don’t mind. I’m just giving her some PI lessons.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hayley was teaching me the art of manipulating men. It’s all about confidence and eye contact.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Yeah, if you can entice a man with your gaze you can lie, steal, cheat, what have you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My wife is out there fighting for her life. Why are you wasting my time?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Wait, what? Why didn’t you tell me?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Sorry. I figured it wasn’t my place. Now, look, Rick. You asked for my help. You want it or not?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s the catch? Because I’m thinking with you there’s always a catch.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: There’s only one. No cops.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Differing agendas. The cops serve and protect the city. I serve and protect me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Fine. No cops.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, what happened to Beckett?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s hurt and she’s on the run.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: From whom?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know. It has something to do with the man she’s with.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: What man? Look, I’m here, aren’t I? You’ve got to give to get. Who’s this mystery man?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s East Indian, in his late 20s. He might be sick. He’s dizzy, had a headache, said he needed something to eat. I don’t know. What about you, Hayley? I know you’re holding back on something.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY

utterance.content: Are you saying this is her fault?

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: I’m saying, she’s never going to be happy just being Mrs. Castle. She needs to tilt at windmills. It’s in her DNA. Like a moth to the flame. And we all know what happens to the moth at the end.

utterance.speaker: BRACKEN
utterance.content: Get me out of here.

utterance.speaker: AJ

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just the person I was looking for.

utterance.content: I recommend the with. It comes with less prison time.
